newsitem.title: UK: Superscape shares up after new stock placed.
newsitem.headline: Superscape shares up after new stock placed.

text.p: Shares in virtual reality software supplier Superscape VR Plc forged ahead on Tuesday after the company successfully placed a new share issue.
In a statement, the company said it had placed 417,895 new shares at 440p, raising a net 1.8 million stg to fund development work and broaden its shareholder base.
The stock was trading at 475p, up 32-1/2 by 1400 GMT.
"They've got the stock away and it's been very well received," one trader said. "It's all good news."
He said Superscape is a volatile stock which tends to move sharply on any news affecting the company.
Shares in Superscape have rallied from 397-1/2 at the start of the year having shown a downward trend for most of 1996.
